page.title: 07MATTHEW BROWN BREWERY,B'BURN
page.content: Matthew Brown, an independently owned brewery was founded in 1830. It employs a large workforce and has over 500 Pubs throughout the North West, selling beers under the names of 'Lion Ales' Â£Theakston' and Â£Slalom Lager'. Recently there has been a great deal of publicity because another brewery called Â£Scottish & Newcastle Breweries' has been trying to "take over" Brown's. Matthew Brown is resisting this action and has put advertisements in newspapers and in its public houses. Also outside most of it's pubs there is a banner stating that the brewery is NOT FOR SALE. A lot of public interest has occurred in the town and supporters of the brewery have taken part in protest marches and have signed petitions. At present the issue has been referred to the Monopolies Commission for investigation.
